item.title: Path of Exile 2: How to Get Greater Jeweller's Orb
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Farm Greater Jeweller's Orb in PoE 2
  • How to Trade For Greater Jeweller's Orb in PoE 2

The Greater Jeweller's Orb can be used to add a fourth link to a skill gem in Path of Exile 2 . Players wanting to flesh out their endgame builds will want to prioritize obtaining this currency to socket additional support gems on their skills, which can be a huge upgrade in DPS and survivability.

Unfortunately, the Greater Jeweller's Orb and Perfect Jeweller's Orb (5-link item) are exceedingly rare drops, even for players mapping in the endgame consistently. Luckily, there are ways to stack the odds in your favor. Here's how.

How to Farm Greater Jeweller's Orb in PoE 2

The Greater Jeweller's Orb is an extremely rare drop from random monsters in Path of Exile 2 , meaning it can technically drop from any monsters you kill, even in the campaign. However, the drop rate is so low that the only realistic way to reliably farm for this item is in the very late endgame in Tier 10+ maps.

Breaches are the absolute best way to farm for the Greater Jeweller's Orb (among other items) because of the sheer number of monsters you can kill in a very small window. Using a build with great wave-clear is not required for this strategy, but it does make it more efficient. Secondly, the rarity of the Waystones you are using matter a lot in determining the possible drops from a map. And finally, always make sure to use any Precursor Tablets you have on the nearby Towers in order to increase the drop rate and quantity of dropped items. Here's an overview of the best Greater Jeweller's Orb farming setup in PoE 2 .

Farm Location

Any Breach in a wide open Grass biome map (details listed below).

Waystones

T10+ fully upgraded Corrupted Delirous maps (use Orb of Alchemy -> Exalted Orb -> Delirium Instills -> Vaal Orb - if needed)

Best Waystone Modifiers

Increased Number of Rare Monsters, Increased Pack Size, Increased Item Quantity, Increased Number of Monster Packs, Increased Quantity/Rarity of Items Found, Rare Monsters have 1 additional modifier.

Best Atlas Skill Tree Node

Local Knowledge (Increases the drop rate of Socket Currency by 40% in Grass Biomes. Greater Jeweller's Orbs count as Socket Currency.)

Build

Fast wave clear with decent defences (e.g. Ice Strike Invoker Monk, Deadeye Ranger, Stormweaver Sorcerer)

How Does Local Knowledge Work

Local Knowledge is an early node you can path towards in the Atlas tree of Path of Exile 2 , which is often misunderstood. While it does not increase your drop rate directly, it shifts the weighting of drops so that you get more Socket Currency drops (+40%) if you're in a Grass biome . Lesser Jeweller's Orb , Greater Jeweller's Orb , and Perfect Jeweller's Orb all count as Socket Currency, which makes it much more likely that you'll get one of these to drop if you have the Local Knowledge node activated in your Atlas tree.

This is a double-edged sword, however, because Local Knowledge also makes it so that Desert Biomes drop more Baryas and Ultimatums (not desirable if you've completed your Ascendancy) and Mountains Biomes drop more Gold (very bad). To ensure you do not inadvertently shoot yourself in the foot, make sure to respec out of Local Knowledge whenever you're doing a map that's not a Grass, Forest, or Swamp biome, or better yet, only spec into Local Knowledge when you know you're in a map ripe for the picking. Here are all the Grass biome maps where you can farm Greater Jeweller's Orbs:

Map

Biome

Augury

Grass/Forest/Swamp

Blooming Field

Grass/Forest

Crypt

Grass/Mountain/Desert

Decay

Grass/Forest/Swamp

Hidden Grotto

Grass/Mountain/Forest/Swamp

Seepage

Grass/Forest/Swamp

Savannah

Grass/Desert

Vaal Factory

Grass/City

How to Trade For Greater Jeweller's Orb in PoE 2

The second way, and by far the more reliable one, is to directly trade for a Greater Jeweller's Orb on Path of Exile 2's trading website or in-game currency exchange. Using the currency exchange is better in the sense that there is no possibility of getting scammed, it's more convenient, and you get an accurate sense for what the item is actually worth. However, the trading website has the potential of being the cheaper option as players often have Greater Jeweller's Orbs listed for cheaper on there, though you may have to do some digging.

To use the Currency Exchange, talk to Alva after reaching Act 3 Cruel and select the relevant options. In the 'I Want' section, punch in Greater Jeweller's Orb, and in the 'I Have' section, put in Exalted Orb/Divine Orb. This will automatically show you the current going rate for this transaction. Put in an order either for exactly the asking price or slightly higher than the market rate (if the price is in decimals) in order to get the item immediately. You can also go lower, but there won't be many takers.

When searching the trade site, make sure to select Exalted Orb under Buyout Price in the filters. This is because the site seems to equate 10 Exalted Orb to 1 Divine Orb which will affect the order in which the items show up (pictured above).

To use the Trading website, go to this address while having Path of Exile 2 open in the background. Search for Greater Jeweller's Orb, and you'll see all the listings sellers have put up on the website. Click on 'Direct Whisper' to send a message to the seller in-game.

If the Direct Whisper button is greyed out, click on the down arrow next to it and select Copy Whisper to copy the same message to the clipboard. Then, paste this message in the in-game chat to send the Whisper.

item.title: Stardew Valley Fan Builds Player's Farm in Minecraft
item.description:
Summary

  • Stardew fan recreates farm in Minecraft with impressive attention to detail.
  • Fans eagerly anticipate the completion of the project for a chance to experience Stardew Valley in Minecraft.
  • Fusion of Minecraft and Stardew highlights freedom in both games, showcasing creativity and dedication.

A Stardew Valley fan is planning to recreate the game's world within Minecraft , and has already shared their rendition of the player's farm. The Stardew Valley reimagining is clever, and gives a hint as to what the game could look like if it had been developed with a different style.

Stardew Valley fans are a dedicated bunch, with many not only consistently playing the game after hundreds of hours, but also building charming tributes to the title. There are few sights more recognizable to players than the Stardew Valley farm, which is left to the player after their grandfather passes away. That farm, in its dilapidated state, is what this player has now shared.

Reddit user FriendStatus4642 uploaded images of their design and is looking for input from the community as they work on creating the entirety of the game's map within Minecraft . So far, their effort to recreate the farm is impressive. The player's farmhouse, mushroom cave, and even broken-down greenhouse are all present, but it's the little details that make this build stand out. FriendStatus4642 has included things one would expect to see around their home in Stardew , like the shipping bin, mailbox, and even the wooden planks that the farmer's pet bowl is placed on. In this instance, they've even included a cat sitting alongside its bowl, making it look like a morning in Stardew Valley when one's pet is waiting for their water dish to be filled.

Stardew Valley Fans Are Enthusiastic About Minecraft Build

The majority of people responding to the post have been extremely positive, with many hoping that once the project is complete, FriendStatus4642 will share it so that they can experience Stardew Valley in the 3D blocky environment of Minecraft for themselves. FriendStatus4642 commented, saying that after everything is done, they want to integrate an existing Stardew Valley Minecraft mod so that players can have as close to the full Stardew experience as possible while exploring the world.

Stardew Valley and Minecraft have been combined in the past by fans, and it doesn't come as much of a surprise. Part of Minecraft 's appeal is the ability to build whatever a player wants, and while the gameplay of the two games differ, many Stardew fans are also Minecraft players, and vice versa. Both games give the player a surprising amount of freedom. While Minecraft drops players into the world and lets them choose what to do, both games have enough appeal and are open-ended enough that many players have spent upwards of a thousand hours in the games. It will be interesting to see how FriendStatus4642's project progresses and further brings the two worlds together.

item.title: Pokemon GO January Community Day Classic Pokemon Revealed
item.description:
Summary

  • Ralts is the featured Pokemon in January's Community Day Classic on January 25 from 2-5 pm local time.
  • Evolving Kirlia during the event yields Gardevoir or Gallade with Charged Attack Synchronoise, dealing 80 damage.
  • Players can access Special Research, Timed Research, bundles, rewards, and new showcases during the event.

Pokemon GO has revealed Ralts as the Pokemon featured in January's Community Day Classic. The event will take place on January 25, with Pokemon GO players having the opportunity to catch Gardevoir's base form, considered the best Psychic-type of Gen 3.

Community Day is a recurring event that celebrates players of Niantic's augmented reality game and is always highly anticipated by the community. To give trainers a second chance, Pokemon GO introduced Community Day Classic in 2022, which revisits previous Community Days. In 2024, specifically, Porygon, Bagon, Cyndaquil, and Beldum were the pocket monsters featured in the Community Day Classic editions of January, April, June, and August.

Pokemon GO has revealed that Ralts will be the featured Pokemon at January's Community Day Classic. The event takes place on January 25 from 2 pm to 5 pm local time, and during this period Ralts will appear in the wild more often, with trainers having the chance of finding a shiny one. Evolving Kirlia, the evolution of Ralts, during Pokemon GO 's Community Day Classic, or up to five hours after the event ends, will give trainers a Gardevoir or Gallade that knows the Charged Attack Synchronoise. The ability deals 80 damage in raids, trainer battles, and gyms. Other bonuses available will be extended duration for Lure Modules and Incense and reduced distance for hatching eggs in incubators.

Pokemon GO Brings Ralts Back in January 2025 Community Day Classic

  • When: Saturday, January 25, 2025, from 2 pm to 5 pm local time
  • Featured Pokemon: Ralts
  • Evolving Kirlia will give trainers Gardevoir or Gallade who know Charged Attack Synchronoise
  • Event bonuses
    • 1/4 Hatch Distance when Eggs are placed into Incubators during the event.
    • Lure Modules activated during the event will last for three hours.
    • Incense (excluding Daily Adventure Incense) activated during the event will last for three hours.
    • Take a few snapshots during Community Day for a surprise!

  • Added for the event:
    • $2 Special Research
    • Timed Research
    • Community Day Continued Timed Research
    • Field Research
    • New Showcases
    • Ultra Community Day Box for $4.99
    • Bundles of 1350 and 480 PokeCoins

For $2, players will be able to purchase Special Research with rewards such as a Premium Battle Pass, a Rare Candy XL, and three encounters with Ralts that have themed backgrounds from the current season. Timed Research will reward players with four Sinnoh Stones and an encounter with Ralts. The Community Day Classic will have a new Continued Timed Research, rewarding trainers with Ralts encounters with special backgrounds, and a Field Research giving Stardust and Great Balls as rewards. New Showcases and offers will be launched, with a $4.99 Ultra Box (Pokemon GO Web Store), and two bundles; one for 1350 and the other for 480 PokeCoins (in-game store).

Niantic added Ralts in 2017 with the debut of the Hoenn region in Pokemon GO , with Feeling Pokemon appearing for the first time on Community Day in August 2019. This is yet another of the activities confirmed by the developers for January, which includes the return of Shadow Ho-Oh to Pokemon GO on an upcoming Shadow Day. Players are also awaiting details of the Lunar New Year, a seasonal event that has been taking place since 2018.

item.title: Accidental Win - Mortar vs Aircraft!
item.description: A player accidentally strikes an aircraft with a mortar in Battlefield and more wins.
